text: Amazing quality food, amazing service and great price. Truly one of the best restaurants in Vegas

Ninja Teriyaki-S2G is the real deal. It is actually own n operate by a Japanese owner. So U know the food is as authentic as it come. Most Sushi restaurants r operate by Koreans now. So it is a fresh breeze to find a true Japanese chef at work.

First time here... Ordered chicken bento, shrimp tempura roll, chk teriyaki bowl. My boyfriend had the Teriyaki bowl he said it was decent, he finds a competitor teriyaki bowls to much better in flavor. I enjoyed my meal- it was delish. Good portion size had to take home half of our of order. I suggest trying out this spot.  The girl at front of counter has no personal - appears  she hates her job. Not once did she checked on us until she noticed we were done with our meal then she asked how was the food. The place was clean, restroom clean, quite atmosphere.

Ordered through GrubHub.

Over 30 minutes late..  chicken wings were cold.. udon soup is warm ... have to reheat it ... was gonna call GrubHub customer service to refund the tip, but just so this restaurant know , they don't deserve it.

Unfortunately they don't have sushi lunch specials anymore. My salmon nichi was discolored which usually happens when the raw fish isn't kept at a proper temperature so I couldn't eat it. Nothing impressive. Debating if I want to give them another chance.

The chicken bento has everything and is delish
..love the croquets ...comes with Teri chicken, Mac salad, seaweed , Cali roll ..perf for lunch

The cold noodle salad is also very tasty...also love the spam roll!! 

Can't wait to try everything else!

I love having good lunch places near my house!!  In kind of a weird area but the food is worth going here!
Ordered and was ready super fast. Amazing and delicious. Definitely my new to go sushi spot.
Great price for a big chicken sesame ginger bowl and a green tea.  Lots of rice, lots of chicken, good flair. This will become a go to for quick, cheap and filling.

Great food- price right.
They always have something new on their chalk board menu. My fave is the tofu nugget and teriyaki plate. Sushis taste really good. 
The owners are actually pure Japanese, thats why the menu is so authentic.
Service is very good too. Place is clean. 
I hope they branch out in my area, southwest.i

Have eaten here many times in the past and am consistently impressed by the quality each time.  I've occasionally had an off night even at upscale sushi joints around town, and although some visits have tasted better than others at Sushi Ninja, I've never been let down.

Love the Kim chi in the chicken bento box, the California roll is one of the best I've had (I know, not super authentic sushi but it's terrific).  Also recommend the rainbow roll and anything tempura there is very good.  It's nothing fancy inside, but for a quick bite in, or better yet to go you can't miss.  Will try the udon in the future but I'm not sure if I'd know if it's good or not?

Came back! Beef udon 5.99. Okame udon 5.99, veg tempura udon 5.99. I like seeing these prices when I usually see udon for 8+ bucks! 

Made to order so don't expect to run in and out.

I do not know what other people ordered, but I got the chicken bento box, and the chicken teriyaki bowl with a rainbow roll on the side.
OH MY GOSH, the sushi tastes like it was made DAYS ago, the rice is hard, the seaweed salad was gooey and tasted like bad ocean water, the mac salad was dried out and just plain nasty. 
The chicken teriyaki was very similar ro one of the Costco chicken patties - which are good but you can purchase an entire pack for the amount you'll spend on a bowl here.
Here's to hoping I don't get violently ill from it! Save the money and go somewhere nice.

Great food. I tried the spicy teriyaki, and large, and oh boy did it fill me up! With extra veggies I was bloated (lot of food filled me up). Great food for the price. And much better than your typical fast food places. Ninja Teriyaki is definitely the place to go for a authentic Japanese, Fast Food. I can't wait to try the other menus. But as the service goes, I was busy doing errands and needed something different and fast. So I looked up at yelp and saw 
Ninja Teriyaki had good reviews. I am pleased. :)

Good service, friendly cashier at the front and speedy in-out if you order for pick up.
I really like this place food is really good prices are super affordable and the staff is very nice, they get five stars from me for sure!
Great bowls, simple sushi. Ninja Teriyaki is fast, the staff is friendly, all is clean and well organized.

Addicted to the place had to go back to get my lunch for the week but this time I order for pick up and let me say they are fast , they had it done in 10 minutes so by the time I got there it was ready and waiting for me.

I've been here 3 times and liked the food. However when I tried to take advantage of the $5 cash back for your first online order, they refused to give me cash back as it said and wanted to give me a $5 off coupon. That is very different than cash back. So they lied in their advertisement. Had I known, I wouldn't have bought what I bought, so I was fooled into buying their food. I hate businesses that do that. I told the cashier, who was rude, that I don't want another coupon when it clearly said cash, pointing to the words. She went to talk to the owner, who was too lazy to come out and address it, and he told her that she could only give me the coupon. Even though I like the food, I will never go back to a restaurant that lies like that. So they lost a customer who would've regularly returned. They didn't seem to care when I left and offered no apologies. No wonder the restaurant is so empty whenever I go there. Liars can't keep their businesses forever.

I do my best to support small local businesses; however, I came here based on the 4 star review. I came in on a Thursday for a quick lunch. The food quality was really bad. The tuna was barely pink and they do give much fish anyway. The roll my wife ordered was all rice and more pale pink spicy tuna. I gave this restaurant an extra star because the staff we really nice. I won't be coming back. Definitely just "meh!"
I used to eat here 2-3 times a week. The food and service are good, but I stopped going there after they raised their prices.

This is the reason I love Groupon. It takes me to places that I would normally never go to, or give a reason to go to. Ninja Teriyaki completely surprised me, you can even say in a pleasant way.

So, this spot is located over on the east side near the Donut Hut, and around that area. Walking in, this place reminded me of hole in the wall joints that I am particularly fond of. After ordering, I sat down at the bar and awaited my order.

First, the chef was kind enough to give me a glass of water to sip on. I really appreciated that. Shortly after, my food had arrived. I ordered a side of Hijiki, which came first. It was a marinated black seaweed dish that had other vegetables tossed inside of it. I liked it, it had a real clean taste, and the seaweed was fresh. I enjoyed the simplicity of it.

Then the bento came up. The California roll was good. The crab was fresh and the rice was cooked correctly, so I appreciated that. The chicken teriyaki wasn't too sweet, and the chicken was tender and not overcooked. The mac salad wasn't overdressed and the macaroni was cooked to al dente. And finally, the tempura'd items, the mash potato and shrimp, were also very enjoyable as well.

On my next visit, I ordered the chicken katsu combo and the veggie egg rolls. Let me go on record by saying this, Ninja might have some of the best veggie egg rolls in town. The filling was amazing. As for the chicken katsu, the chicken was moist and tender, and the crust wasn't too thick, but was still crispy. Once again, the rice was cooked perfectly, and the side salad was a nice touch.

I wanted to give it 5 stars, especially due to the great value for the quality of food, but I don't like how some business' handle Groupon. I mean, if I have 10 dollars worth of Groupon bucks, and my total comes up to 9.99 before tax, like... just let it go. I think that this will be a big reason why I won't come back here. Even though the food was great.. I just don't fly like that.

I really wish I could eat here every single day! My boyfriend loves the chicken teriyaki and I LOVE the tofu and veggie teriyaki bowl! The rice has this perfect texture and they sell cream sodas! Owner is very nice and always remembers our usual orders :) 4/5 because I've only been a good few times but so far no problems whatsoever. Please keep this place open!

If I could give negative stars, I would. I ordered a chicken bento box and a cucumber roll. 
WORST food ever. The chicken smelled as if it were from the frozen section at smiths. The California roll barely had any avocado in it. The ginger was disgusting looking. I think the only thing I ate was the unidentifiable fried thing. Needless to say I will not be going back.

I am pleasantly surprised by this place! I am always reluctant to eat sushi from any place besides YAMA (my favorite) but for a quick, reasonably priced lunch it can't be beat! The food was fresh (had a little bit of a wait which can be a good thing) and the atmosphere was calm and relaxing. The lady who took my order was very friendly, helpful, and informative. After I brought the food back to work I was worried that I forgot to grab napkins, soy sauce, and chopsticks but behold! She put plenty in the bag! No complaints from me, I will definitely be visiting this place again to try more options on their menu!
Looking for some sushi but never in this part of town. Found this place and they have a 4 star review. I give them a 5. Clean restaurant, nice staff, tasty food, and the price is very reasonable.

Terrible!!!! Yelpers  gave it 5 stars why????!!!??!!!  I should of known when I walked in there at noon and the place was empty. Nothing but Spanish was being spoken, order taken by a white girl who looked like she hated life, the sushi was terrible the week old crap you can buy at albertsons tastes better. This place is far from authentic and the sushi is crap, it tastes like what it is: sushi made by Mexicans. Restaurant tucked away in a rundown shopping center in a bad part of town what else do you need to know. Wasted my 20$

Really good place, fast service, taste is great, very fresh. More of a to go/pick up type of restaurant. Very affordable! Bad location though. 
However I still recommend it, and will definitely visit again.

Good price, real japanese chef who knows taste and presentation are first.  I think the cheapest place even with the high quality around the area.  This is how udon is supposed to taste.  Don't settle for korean and chinese versions cooked by mexicans in the back.

I ordered the Shrimp Tempura Roll and the Salmon Roll. Honestly, the quality of the food made me disappointed and sad..the food tasted off. The ginger in my wife's bento box was discolored.... We tried a few bites, and just got up and left. I'm hoping we don't get sick. 

Price is cheap but I've learned I'd rather pay more to go out to eat than to pay less and risk getting sick. Btw the chicken in the bento box tasted like those predue frozen chicken pieces you'd buy at Smiths....

Low prices, fast service, decent quality. Wouldn't have known about this place if they hadn't been featured on Groupon- even without a discount, you can get a fairly healthy and filling lunch here for under $10.

Favorite pick is the salmon bento box: portion of salmon, chicken "teriyaki", and cali roll plus sides of mac salad and seaweed salad. Added on an order of eggrolls. Salmon was a little oilier than expected, chicken was moist dark meat fried nuggets but I did not taste any teriyaki seasonings or sauce?, Cali roll was fresh, sides were just okay. You can certainly do worse on this side of town.

Interior has a small sushi bar, a lounge-like area with a TV and magazines, and several tables. Walk-up ordering format, most of their orders seem to be takeout judging by the name and lack of dine-in customers.
The lunch special is a good deal~ California roll and four pieces of nigiri sushi. The shrimp tempura roll is also tasty.
Authentic food and can't beat the price. My new go-to Japanese restaurant! Excited to go back!

We eat a lot of Asian food since my husband and son are thai with my son enjoying Japanese food the most.   Needless to say this is our 2nd time eating the food at ninja and it's absolutely delicious.   After I read the 1 star review we all agree it was probably left by another Japanese restaurant.   The chef here is accomplished and knows exactly what he is doing.   The prices are reasonable not cheap.  8 pc of California rolls is $4.49 and 8 pc shrimp tempura was  $6.99.  The location isn't the best but we go for the food not the sightseeing.  They have a small dine in nothing fancy,  take out and delivery.   There was a Groupon not sure it's still available.   Trust me the food is superb and we will keep eating it.

Great sushi for a reasonable price! We ordered a Lunch special (California roll + 4 pieces of sushi), spicy tuna roll and a salmon avocado roll- spicy tuna has a nice kick to it and the sushi was fresh! Also got a spicy chicken teriyaki and the okame udon(which was my favorite- the broth is on point!). 

Totally recommend and will be back soon!

This has to be the best Japanese take out joint in Vegas! Everything is made to order and yet they still serve up high quality, delicious food at dirt cheap prices! I've tried a majority of items on the menu by now and among my favorites are the karage ($3.99), chicken teriyaki ($5.49) and veggie egg rolls ($1.50 for 2). Although I typically get these items, there I've never had anything on the menu I didn't like. Their bentos are all good and so is the beef sukiyaki, katsu and udon! 

The owner appears to be the main cook here which is probably why the food is always consistent. Orders all come out hot and fresh, and sometimes a little too fresh because it's so burning hot, it's tough to eat! The front of house employees are always very nice and polite and I've never had an issue with them. My order is always correct, unlike other take out places, and I no longer feel the need to check my bag anymore because, again I've never had an issue with this place after eating here so many times.

I originally found out about this place through Groupon and they seem to run Groupon offers pretty regularly so watch out for that! Just keep in mind that if you have a $10 Groupon, they will make you spend over $10! That's the only downside when trying to redeem an offer here...

I only wished that they weren't located so far away (or in a shady looking shopping center) so I could go more often!

Used a groupon first time and it was so yummy
Totally worth going there again and again. 
My ast and i go often its easy, u can call and pick it up no wait.  Havent had anything yet that isnt delicious
Fast, fresh and delicious.  Just make sure to ask for teriyaki sauce as they tend to leave it on the lighter side with sauces.

For the past few visits, we get the Groupon for Ninja Family Sampler for pick up and have a nice lunch back at our place.

This past visit was the same as the previous meals, very good.

It's a lot of food for under $40 using the group on.  This is two meals for my family of 4.  Lots of variety of food which means every one is happy.

Soup, appies, meats, rice, salads.  This is the perfect meal to bring the kids up from the pool, eat up and then head down for the afternoon session.

We've done this at least 10x and have never been disappointed.

Love this place!! It's so convenient and the service has been great. I keep coming for the chicken bento box! It's a lot of food and hits the spot every time. I recommend this place for take out obviously, it's quick and delicious!
Stopped by after moving back to the east side-  excellent us the only word to describe it!  Don't let the location deter you this is some of the best sushi and teriyaki in town!  We will be back!

New menu item
Tonkatsu bento $8.99
Udon $5.99
With tuna roll $8.99
Kara age chicken bento $6.99
Katsu curry w rice and salad $8.99

I'm really surprised that this place has a lot of stars.  I mean the prices for sushi is good but the quality is terrible which shud be expected so idk why it has so many stars.  Maybe it was for the terriyaki bowls which I never tried.

I highly recommend this wonderful restaurant. The food is excellent, fresh, and authentically Japanese. We had them cater a Japanese funeral service, and everyone was extremely pleased with the food. The quality, freshness, presentation, and customer service were top-notch. We ordered the D Package and Ninja Party Platters. We were able to order a wide variety of dishes; the shrimp tempura, chicken teriyaki, gyoza, and sushi were especially delicious.

They also went above and beyond in customer service. We highly recommend this gem of a restaurant if you enjoy authentic, fresh Japanese food.
Tasty food, excellent service! Been there quite a few times and we've had the chicken bowl, spicy chicken bowl, curry rice, gyoza, pork cutlet, beef sukiyaki and udon. All was great!
I love this spot my orders are always on point. They always give me extra eel sauce, and make my sushi exactly how I order it. I def recommend this spot.

I recently came here with a couple friends because we got a Groupon for the family dinner. It was a great deal with the Groupon (not sure what the full price is). I had to order the food an hour in advance with a very nice Hispanic lady in the phone and when I got there an hour later, the food was already waiting for us, still fresh! The chicken was great and I like that the family sampler comes with 3 different sauces to try. The tofu nuggets were amazing and my boyfriend who is a carnivore thought they tasted like chicken. The standout of course was the sushi entree. Our meal came with 2 California rolls and a shrimp tempura roll, all were well made and very good. We also ordered a tiger roll which wasn't included in the sampler but well worth the $8 price. Overall, the prices are very reasonable and I'll definitely be back with or without a Groupon!

i've been craving Yoshinoya beef bowl for the longest time and was depressed that the location by UNLV closed down.  i'm from socal so yoshinoya is easy to come by.  this was the best alternative and my craving was satisfied.  if they had different sizes like a large bowl, i would of ordered it but the portion was decent and i was full after i combined it with a miso soup.  

i will definitely be visiting more often and trying different dishes.

I ordered the poke & it was a tiny portion at a full price. Not very tasty, dated looking. I would not go back. I even mentioned how small it was and the man working could care less. Considering I was the only one there he could have at least tried to be more accommodating. I'm really not picky, it looked like a tiny side dish & was bland.
Called in my order and headed out. It was wrapping up right when I got there. The bento box was so delicious and such a deal for 9 bucks. Everything is reasonably priced and so tasty.

Called in my order 1hr20mins before arriving. They said it would take 1 hour. We arrive and NOTHING is ready. They say wait another 30mins! Not a great first impression. The Spanish at the checkout desk woman wasnt really any help. 
It's really disorganized, not happy and probably will never go back. Food takes WAY too long to make. I think they are understaffed. 
The blurry ninja on their shop banner gives you a tip on how much attention to detail they give.
Great food and service!! Will be back again! Plenty of parking and order came out quick!

Wanted to check out the sukiyaki. For what I got, the taste was good, but lacking in quantity. The portion had 95% rice and 5% sukiyaki. Also tried their shrimp tempura, it was cheap but ok.
Probably not be back.

Great value! Great service!

I've seen this place in passing tons - but was hesitant to stop in because the prices are so low/reasonable and I was afraid of "value" sushi (ie; late night grocery store binge) - not the case at all! Great quality. Got a salmon avocado roll. Delicious. Perfect salmon to avocado ratio. 

They also offer daily specials (looked great - but was craving sushi) as well as a few beers and apps. 

Over all a cool place. Casual atmosphere. Extremely friendly and fast service - and delivers within 7 miles. Definitely a new favorite.

This is my favorite to go spot on his side of town. The food reminds me of the bento shops I use to frequent when I lived in Osaka, Japan, and the quality is excellent. The seating area is a little sparse, but it is clean and inviting. I keep their menu bookmarked and I order ahead when I want a nice sushi meal to go. Try the lunch and dinner specials and enjoy a beer or sake while you wait for your to go meal. The Ramen salad is superb and this is one of the few places in town that serves it.
Great fix for any sort of Japanese or sushi craving decently priced and always something on special.

We had read a review in the Review Journal and it was The Neighborhood Pick of
the Week.
We live very close by and we are Seniors and were thrilled that there is a
neighborhood restaurant so convenient to our home.
We were so impressed with the lunch special which consisted of a California Roll and 4 slices of Sushi with Salmon, Shrimp, Tuna and white fish.
The value was so exceptional for the excellent sushi.
We returned on Monday at dinner time and they were nice enough to give us the same lunch special at dinner time.
We want to try the Bento Box also very reasonable with a variety of Japanese Food.
The owner Masa has outstanding background, having cooked at some of the
best Japanese restaurants in Las Vegas, Including Nobu at Caesar's Palace.
Masa and his partner are so friendly and we had a good conversation with them
sitting at the Sushi Bar.  Besides sushi they have a great Japanese menu,.
We expect to return to Ninja very often.  The restaurant has several tables, besides the sushi bar, is exceptionally clean.

1 star for location (whole in the wall) 
5 stars for speed of service
2 stars for the menu, it was limited, but everyone found something they liked. . Including an aunt who didn't eat sushi. 
5 stars for kids menu 
2 stars for decor. A little outdated and akward.
3 stars for service 
This spot fulfilled my need for sushi, and my Wallets' need for a break from the high prices of the strip. 
* we got chicken and it was great.  All of it! Chicken strips, chicken terriaki, and Jappanese fried chicken..

Thank you, yelpers.. great job.

This is real deal, own and operated by Japanese chef.
I always get ramen salad and tofu nugget. What I know, is the owners are high ranking chef at the MGM resorts or cezar palace. They re pretty good.

Yummy Yummy in my tummy! I tried them the first time thru bitesquard 3rd party ordering and the sushi I got was fantastic! I ordered a rainbow roll! I liked it so much that I will be back and will stop by the restaurant the next time!!

First time I tried the chicken teriyaki bowl. It was extremely fresh. The chicken was cooked perfectly it was very moist and juicy. The sauce was good too but next time I think I'm going to try the spicy chicken. The portion size was great.  It was a very generous serving.

Today I got the bento box and a side of spicy tuna for my boyfriend for lunch. He seemed surprised when I showed up with sushi take out! He really liked the spicy tuna. The bento box is awesome.  It's full of a variety of things. 

The quality here is A+
I should of took some photos. The presentation in these togo boxes...wow! 
And can you say affordable.  

Can't wait to go here with my boyfriend.  He's a sushi lover and I'm not. We never go out to sushi because I don't like it.  This place though. What a concept. The owner/chef really have something here. The owner/chef even said he could make me any type of roll I want that doesn't have fish. 

This place is so laid back. It's very clean inside too. Super casual. I felt very comfortable there. The other staff are very friendly. 

I have nothing bad to say about this place other then the location. For me it's not a bad location because I go to the family dollar next door and I noticed it was there. I hope people don't miss this gem driving by.

I honestly loved this place. The location is kind of ehhh.. but food was good! I had the chicken teriyaki bento box and it was good! The portions are really filling. It came with some potato fried thing.. really good!
I finally stopped in to try this place. All I can say is WOW! Quick service.  Great price! Can't wait to go back.

i got chicken teriyaki & 4 egg rolls which is 2 orders. i also paid $2 extra for more chicken which i suggest because you will get so much. the price was $10.49 total. i got it to-go so the teriyaki sauce sunk into the rice but really it's not very much sauce anyway which is a positive because i believe the chef wants the main focus to be on the good, high quality, well prepared chicken & not over sauce it with sweetness to mask the flavor of the chicken. if you want a lot of teriyaki sauce i'm sure you can ask for more in a container. the chicken was delicious & prepared like barbecue style. you never know what you are getting these days at fast food places or supermarkets when it comes to chicken because there are a lot of strange treatments & mixtures. i can say honestly this chicken did not seem artificial at all, far better than fast food places & definitely the low price chicken from supermarkets. it may possibly be organic. this is not fast food anyway, but a casual counter-order restaurant. it just has low prices, but great portions. i also like the interior atmosphere & pleasant customer service. it was my first time there & i will definitely go back.

First time trying this place. I had the teriyaki chicken bowl , the chicken was hard to chew , "vegetables" it was only cabbage and the taste of the chicken was like next day chicken . Definitely not a place to go back!

Was craving sushi after my dentist office and found this. It's a small menu of sushi so pls check it out before you drive/call in. It's not s typical sushi place. The decor inside was outdated but it didn't stop the food from tasting pretty good. Not the best I've had but pretty good! They have the basic rolls that made me happy. I got a salmon roll and rainbow roll for $16.

Right down the street from my work makes this place my new go to place for quick yummy sushi!

Sushi is well made, for the price you're paying. In no way shape or form does this place stack up to more than half the sushi places I've reviewed for you fellow Yelpers! With that being said it is good for what I come here for:

Tasty Sushi I can enjoy in under 30 minutes in a clean, friendly environment.

Their menu is very limited but I had a California Roll and a Shrimp Tempura Roll which did the trick of satisfying my weird mid Tuesday sushi cravings. Very basic but good.

**Poke Stop is accessible from inside**

This is the new occupant of the space formerly occupied by Ray's something or other blah blah ramen. I never made it out to that place, but it must not have been that good if it closed shop.

My first visit was a few nights ago. I went with the beef sukiyaki plate for $7.49 ($5.99 bowl cost). The clerk claimed that their plates have a higher portion size than the bowls, but I wasn't buying it after seeing my friend's beef sukiyaki bowl. The beef was pretty good, and so was the noodle... but since it comes with rice in addition to the noodle, I really felt meat-deprived. I did like the green salad with dressing and the extra-peppery macaroni salad, but I'm not sure that the combination is worth the extra $1.50 for me.

I came back today for a chicken teriyaki bowl ($5.49). There is absolutely a ton of chicken, so I enjoyed that aspect. What I disliked was how the flavor seemed to disappear toward the latter half, as if there wasn't enough teriyaki sauce to last, or the sauce wasn't strong enough to last. And it's more or less one note of flavor, as opposed to the Thai dishes served at my favorite lunch spot in this area.

There were a couple other tables at times during dinner, but it was pretty quiet during what would be the peak of dinner at more established places. And I was the only one there when I showed up after peak-lunch.

Haven't tried the sushi yet, so let's say this is only a review of half of the restaurant. There's some candy on the front counter that I haven't tried, and also a bento box and a "specials" board, so browse those if you try out Ninja.

I'll say that it's about 3.5 stars. It's a good lunch spot if you're in the area, nothing more.
Really good beef sukiyaki bowl. Similar to Yoshinoya's gyuudon, but I like Ninja's better. I don't know anyplace else where you can get authentic-tasting Japanese food at these prices.

Had the Chicken Teriyaki Bowl, lots of chicken! Good flavor of sauce and I orders egg rolls which were super hot and tasty as well.

If you order drinks it's from a can but that's not what this is about its about good food for a great price! 
I will be coming back!

Actually really good! i ordered on grubhub, teri chicken bowl, chicken karigae bento and shrimp tempura/spicytuna. The taste was still fresh and the portions were pretty big, the price is cheap in my opinon 5/5!
This place is nothing short of awesome. Best food in town, at the cheapest prices. The owner is quiet, humble and hard working.  I wish it was closer to where I lived.

We ordered dinner thru doordash, due to our vehicle broke down this afternoon.  And after a long exhausting day at the shop waiting with a 3 year old.  And as the hours went by, the crankiness hit a different level, all we wanted to do was get home and just order out. Car still in the shop, uber home because We had enough. We wanted Sushi and the baby wanted noodles, win-win for everyone.  Our delivery gets here and the noodles are missing.  Stopped our Dasher and she said that's all what she gave me and said the order was complete.  Called the restaurant and Jose answer and said that the ticket was in the office and didn't notice it and wanted us to come pick it up.  He then reversed his story that he forgot to make it, and then saying that there is only 2 of em there and the manager or owner will refund me my money. Which one is it?!?!  I explained that I don't have a car and I order for a service to be done and delivered. He kept on saying it's okay, no problem, come pick it up.  I didnt make the mistake of putting my order in, you guys made the mistake of not getting orders thru. Long story short, they couldn't refund me my money until tomorrow when the manager/owner gets there from 11am-1pm. How do u take my money so fast and now I have to wait for u to settle ur reports to get my money back the next day?   What kind of business is this?!?! U guys dont deserve a 1 star in all honesty. Definitely be the 1st and last for me

Good place to go for a quick carry out sushi, teriyaki or curry at a very good price! I always get the teriyaki chicken bowl, some spicy tuna sushi, California rolls and curry chicken! (Okay, yes... I always order waaay too much food!) Even if I'm just driving through Vegas on the interstate, I'll stop here for my quick sushi fix! Always fresh and good tasting at a great price!
NINJA party was a good deal - 40 pieces for $28.   It wasn't a one-of-a-kind eating experience but for take-out it tasted alright.  I don't think I would bring a large group there though.
Still one of my favorite spots to grab a quick bite. Great food at an unbeatable price! I haven't had a bad anything here yet!

Seriously the best sushi in town to have as take out! My husband and I have been ordering from here for the last month or so.. I just had a baby 2 weeks ago and it is so easy to just call and pick up. Check them out you will NOT regret it

I ordered a chicken bowl spam roll and a California roll ... The chicken bowl was horrible the meat was not quality I instantly bit into grisel and the teriyaki sauce wasn't even good it tasted like peanuts.... I took two bites and threw it away .... Than the spam roll was not impressive and and should probably have teryaki sauce in it... I ordered to go so idk if it's like this when u eat there but I've never ordered sushi from a resturaunt that gave the wasabi and ginger in pre packaged packets .... The California roll was ok .... But in general the sushi was albertsons quality .... I will probably never eat here again unless I'm dying for a California roll and all I have is 3$ but not likely

Try their Beef Sukiyaki its like The Yoshinoya version of the same kind of food. We also ordered there Rainbow roll and it was delicious. For the price and what you are getting its the best deal for Japanese food.

This little strip mall find is a keeper. Super simple decor does not impress, but who cares when they have yummy food at great prices?  

Menu offerings include sushi rolls, nigiri, bento boxes, teriyaki chicken, fried chicken, tofu nuggets, ramen salad, specials and more. All items we ordered were delicious. 

Order to go or make yourself comfy at one of their tables, and enjoy  the Asian music playing. Counter seating is also available. 

Parking is a breeze with plenty of lot parking. 

Staff were friendly, professional and even greeted and thanked me.

Hubby and I ate here last week. He got the chicken teriyaki and I got tofu veggie bowl. Both delicious and very reasonably priced. Hubby liked his choice so much he stopped by this week and ordered another.  Clean and friendly place. Will definitely come back and recommend.

I would have never thought that this place would be pretty good by looking at the outside and how the inside is set up. The area is not the best and it's very plain inside with an old plate lunch place vibes.  It is pretty easy to make your mind up with what you want because there isn't a massive list of food to choose from; plus the prices are pretty good too.

We ordered the Chicken karaage bento, Tonkatsu bento, gyoza, shrimp tempura, the potato croquet and a spicy tuna roll. My wife and I enjoyed it and not to mention they prepare it quickly for you while maintaining quality in the food. If the drive wasn't so far for us I would probably eat here at least twice a week for some quick cheap Japanese food that taste great.

A relatively new spot. Small and basic sushi menu, with other Japanese entrees like sukiyaki and udon bowls.

Sushi is good for the price. i got the cali roll and SA roll, both were good. My gf got the veggie roll and the tofu nuggets and she also liked them both. 

Overall, a good spot for a quick, cheap sushi fix.

Tried their Udon special last week and it was WONDERFUL.  Order of hot and tasty udon noodles plus a tuna roll.  Asked them to sub a spicy tuna roll and it was no problem.  This place is super clean and the staff is fantastic.  U need to try this place.

Went there last night (3/31). Surrounding area is run down and restaurant doesn't look like much when you walk in...but they knocked it out of the park with the food! Fiance and I each ordered our favorite Japanese dishes - beef sukiyaki and tonkatsu curry respectively. And both dishes were outstanding. Great quality meat. Curry was very light tasting as well, excellent even with just the rice, let alone one of the best tonkatsus in town. Will return for take-out some time.
Food is reasonably priced. Prepared well and tasted great. Good amount of food per serving.

Ok so the sushi and the macaroni salad in the bento box was ok, I've had better. And then I reached for the teriyaki chicken and I SPIT IT OUT in my napkin. It literally tasted and smelled like a pet store. It reminded me of my dog. I thought it was just me but when I asked my friend how it tasted she said it reminded her of her dog too. Not going back here again. If I can give this a zero star rating I would.

Decent spot for lunch if you're in the area. The menu prices that they put on the ad are for the base item (eg curry without anything , udon without anything ) if you want extra toppings everything is separately charged. Wouldn't go out of my way to visit unless I was already in the area

This place is amazing the food is delicious and well presented, I had the sushi lunch special. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would easily recommend this place to anyone looking for good sushi in Las Vegas. I see myself eating here often.

I ordered the chicken bento and plain udon. The portion is pretty decent especially for the price, but don't expect anything impressive. I really wish the bento came with a soup. I grouponed this, paying $13 for 2-$10 vouchers. Luckily, what really made my day were their Japanese drink selection and at a very reasonable price. Melon creamy soda; $2! Either way, I'll come back because food here is cheap and can probably last me two meals. 

Food: 3 stars, nothing amazing, but there is a lot of value for $10 and especially if you buy a groupon.
Decor: 2 stars, not sure if they tried to have a decor
Service: N/A, they were nice, but I didn't dine in. 
Prices: 4 stars, seemingly reasonable, they're a bit lower than Japanese food you get in Chinatown.
Second time here, sushi is fresh and esthetically pleasing. Cheapest quality sushi I could find in town ! Friendly and fast service too!

We tried this place for a late lunch with a Living Social deal and LOVED it!  The staff are friendly, the place is clean, the food portions are great and the food is really fresh!  My husband had the fried rice bowl and it was done perfectly.  The bowl was huge but he managed to finish it ;)  I had the sushi lunch which is a CA roll with 4 pieces of sushi.  So fresh.  The only thing I was surprised about was the sushi did not have any wasabi smeared on it between the rice and fish, but I'm not complaining.   Even without the deal, the prices are good.  I want to try the Udon soup next.  I love having little family places in the neighborhood.  And they have these great Japanese golf magazines too.

Surprised by this place.  I would have never gone there if just driving by.  In an old stripmall in a not so glitzy part of town. I went in because of Yelp.  Glad I did.  Very clean and tasty food.  I guess the chef has worked on the strip in some fancy Japanese places and now has his own little place.  Simple menu and friendly staff.  Quick service and great prices.  Good place to stop if you're in this area.  There really aren't very many good options around it.

My favorite place to go for takeout! I call in my order and it's ready to pick up in no time. The food is always hot, fresh and ready when I arrive. The owner is very friendly. Very reasonable price especially for the amount of food and frequently offers Groupons.

This is my go to place for quick japanese. Udon bowls are awesome and u can build your own if you want to. Beef, chicken bowls are awesome. Plus they sell japanese curry too. Service is fast and quick.  They have a limited japanese sushi menu. No they dont have orgasms, volcano, sushi special rolls..they have just enough simple sushi to get your wasabi fix. They have this thing called fried chicken, its the best mochiko chicken i have had in las vegas. What makes it is the siracha aioli dipping sauce. Plus its not overcooked like someplaces. You know where you just took a bite of chicken jerky ball. This is a delicate, moist and crunchy on the outside.

Well I try the place and I order a Simple California Roll I dint see any Asian person inside and the Hispanic Dud Make my Roll the Rice was like brownish but the thing is this The Crab in the center inside off the Roll was to smal' good flavor but a liLittlel bit off Crab  inside

I came here on a Wednesday evening about 5pm. I ordered a chicken bento. It came with chicken teriyaki, macaroni salad, seaweed salad, a shrimp tempura, some lettuce, croquette, 8 piece CA roll, and chicken teriyaki. I don't think I can really complain about the food... it was good and the service was definitely good as well. It is a bit expensive as it was $9 for the bento, but it is definitely a place I would return to. 4.5 stars.

A secret to-go restaurant located just down the street from my work place. Found this spot thanks to my yelpers! The atmosphere is calm, and the food is great quality and delicious. My all time favorite is the Chicken Teriyaki Bento Box. The staff is superb friendly, and the prices are great and the food is high quality. 

The staff is super clean, and you can phone in orders so they can be ready for those of us that are on our lunch hour. Definitely will be a regular until I try the entire menu!
Sushi is great and udon soup and the bento box, we eat here a few times a month always great and fast

Happy to say after communicating directly with the owners and a return visit that they've instilled my faith to once again return here. My usual, 2 rainbow rolls and 2 karaage chickens, were phenomenal--as I'm sure everything else is on the menu. Also, a verbal apology was given by staff which was appreciated. I feel confident once again that this is my favorite neighborhood sushi spot. All is forgiven and a big thank you to Chef Maki and staff.
I had to get something to eat in a hurry Becuase I was in a rush for break. Fast service and I ordered the chicken bowl. Pretty good for a grab and go food place.
Teriyaki bowl is a must. California rolls are really nice! Much cheaper than Irvine... Goodbye. Las Vegas!

What did sushi A say to sushi B?  Wasabi! 
.
Walked in on Monday 1-25-16 at 5:30 PM and placed a to-go order.  This restaurant is located on Desert Inn & Pecos next to the dollar store.  The menu is posted behind the counter on the wall and has all the classic items you'd expect from a sushi joint with very little frills.  No fancy orgasm-sauce-covered-cream cheese-deep-fried nonsense here.  They do have other stuff besides sushi like teriyaki bowls, udon soup, edamame, bento boxes, etc.  
.
$35.62 got me an order of shrimp tempura, an order of fried chicken pieces, two sushi snack rolls, a shrimp tempura roll, and a rainbow roll.  I was on my way in less than 10 minutes!  Talk about ninja fast! 
.
The tempura shrimp were crunchy and very well flavored.  The star of the show was the fried chicken pieces...they were battered and then deep fried and so crunchy and juicy.  Both came with tasty dipping sauces.  
. 
Most of the rolls were maybe one step above gas station sushi...lots of cali roll filler.  I enjoyed the shrimp tempura roll the most.  The rolls were beautifully presented in a sushi tray with ginger and wasabi.  I was given soy sauce, napkins, forks, and chopsticks without having to ask which I think is thoughtful.  
. 
This is a great place if you want sushi but don't want to dine in.  Sometimes you just wanna take it to go and watch some Netflix on the couch.  I realize you can get take-out from just about any sushi place but this place is *designed* for it, friendly, and super fast.
Great food at a great value. Thanks to Yelp, I found this place just down the street from my job. Now I can get fresh sushi for lunch and for less than a fish sandwich at McD's.

Terrible customer service. I was waiting to place an order to go for at least 10 minutes before an employee noticed me. When someone did, she came over and just asked for my order, no apology or explanation. I ordered a spam musubi and salmon avocado roll and I got them pretty quick. The rice for the spam musubi was SOUR and everything else was at room temperature. The salmon was bland and tasteless amongst the mountain of rice on the edges (which fell apart immediately). Overall, the food wasn't terrible but I would not go back. 

Also as a side note, it was very confusing hearing someone sing in Japanese towards the front of the place and then Mexican country music in the kitchen...

To my surprise, it was quite delicious. I'm a little wary about sushi to go places, just because I feel they may not be as fresh, but this place pleasantly surprised me with the quality of their food.

In Vegas this is the best place to go for low priced delicious sushi! Originally being from CA, I'm used to dining on sushi every week, and totally missed it when I moved here, but this place is a great!

When you can feed over three people with sushi, egg rolls, and teriyaki bowls for under $30 I'm a fan!

So excited to find this little gem!  Right by my work and I am so excited!  Friendly, fast service, clean establishment, and the food is great too.  I will be back!  Thank you Yelp for helping me find this place!

Reasonably priced Japanese casual restaurant serving simple sushi, rolls, bentos and rice bowls on the East side of Las Vegas.

I decided to check them out after seeing their Groupon promotion.  It is located in a not too busy strip mall in the part of town I have never visited until coming here.  But it is not that far from the Wynn, just straight down East Desert Inn Road.

Their menu is simple, but still offers a fair selection, plus their specials board has more tempting offers.  You can drop in and order food al la carte to eat on premise or as takeout, they also provide catering services for larger orders.

On my 2 visits, I was pretty much the only customer there, so you will likely never have to wait for an open table if you decide to dine in.  Plus the service was friendly, the entire place (including the restroom) is kept tidy and clean.  And the food order came out reasonably fast.  The food is relatively healthy too, it is not the highest quality Japanese food available in Las Vegas, but for the price and the part of town, it is more than adequate.

Thus far I have tried their Katsu Curry Special (the curry is just the plain curry sauce without any potatoes, carrots, etc.) which has a decent portion and also their Okame Udon (with tofu skin, shrimp tempura, Japanese fish cake and seaweed toppings) and a side of Tuna Roll. Everything was acceptably yummy and fits my diet's macros.  As far as desserts, I don't recall seeing it on their wall menu, which is good, since I didn't need the extra temptation of oh so sweet but alas empty calories.

Bonus for Food Network fans, the TV is always on that channel. So you can eat and watch whatever happens to be on at the moment and maybe get some inspiration of what to eat next.

We stopped by at this place by chance and we were pleasantly surprised. The service was quick, they do both dine in and take away. My shrimp teriyaki was excellent and my boyfriend's chicken teriyaki was delicious too. We also got a salad which was big enough to share. I also love their peach green tee only for 1 dollar. The restroom was clean which is very important to me too. Great neighborhood place! We will definitely come back.
I had vegetarian options, everything was delicious. Miso soup was the best I've had in awhile. The counter boy was polite. I would come back if I was in the area.
